alert.note: Alert for Apple and Lucerne Valleys; Coachella Valley; San Diego County Deserts (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 29 at 12:54PM PST until December 29 at 10:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southern California, including the following areas, Apple and Lucerne Valleys, Coachella Valley and San Diego County Deserts. * WHEN...Through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of normally low or dry washes, creeks, and canals, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A winter storm will bring periods of rain to the deserts through Thursday afternoon. Rainfall totals of one-half to one inch are expected in the high desert and one-quarter to one-half inch in the lower deserts with much of that rainfall for tonight into Thursday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Apple and Lucerne Valleys; Coachella Valley; San Diego County Deserts
